metadata.synopsis: Rolan (the prodigy) reacts to the successful defence of the grove, in the event that he was convinced to stay.

0.speaker: Rolan
0.text: I nearly dispatched those goblins myself, but it seems you managed well enough.
0.context: NodeContext: Idle arrogance, as if he could have taken out an entire camp of enemies if it weren't beneath him

4.speaker: Rolan
4.text: And why wield a masterwork where a butcher's blade will do? My thanks, truly.
4.context: NodeContext: Airy condescension - you saved him a menial task, but it was perfecly suited to you.

1.speaker: Rolan
1.text: They'll sing songs about this, you know. They simply don't know any better.
1.context: NodeContext: As if you should be grateful - the last an aside to himself.

3.speaker: Rolan
3.text: We could've handled those goblins on our own.

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: Nevertheless... I suppose it was decent of you to return.

5.speaker: Rolan
5.text: All that fuss and for what? I'd barely call that a fight.
